verses.verse: And it came to pass in the month <S%H2320><s%> Nisan <S%H5212><s%>, in the twentieth <S%H6242><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of Artaxerxes <S%H783><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%>, when wine <S%H3196><s%> was before <S%H6440><s%> him <S%H5375><s%>, that I took up the wine <S%H3196><s%>, and gave <S%H5414><s%> it unto the king <S%H4428><s%>. And I said <S%H559><s%> unto the king <S%H4428><s%>, Let the king <S%H4428><s%> live <S%H2421><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>: why should not my countenance <S%H6440><s%> be sad <S%H3415><s%>, when the city <S%H5892><s%>, the place <S%H1004><s%> of my fathers <S%H1><s%>' sepulchres <S%H6913><s%>, lieth waste <S%H2720><s%>, and the gates <S%H8179><s%> thereof are consumed <S%H398><s%> with fire <S%H784><s%>?
Then the king <S%H4428><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto me <S%H1245><s%>, For what dost thou make request? So I prayed <S%H6419><s%> to the God <S%H430><s%> of heaven <S%H8064><s%>.

And I said <S%H559><s%> unto the king <S%H4428><s%>, If it please <S%H2895><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%>, and if thy servant <S%H5650><s%> have found favor <S%H3190><s%> in thy sight <S%H6440><s%>, that thou wouldest send <S%H7971><s%> me unto Judah <S%H3063><s%>, unto the city <S%H5892><s%> of my fathers <S%H1><s%>' sepulchres <S%H6913><s%>, that I may build it <S%H1129><s%>.

And the king <S%H4428><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto me <S%H7694><s%> (the queen also sitting <S%H3427><s%> by him <S%H681><s%>,) For how long shall thy journey <S%H4109><s%> be <S%H7725><s%>? and when wilt thou return? So it pleased <S%H3190><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> to send <S%H7971><s%> me <S%H5414><s%>; and I set him a time <S%H2165><s%>.

Moreover I said <S%H559><s%> unto the king <S%H4428><s%>, If it please <S%H2895><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%>, let letters <S%H107><s%> be given <S%H5414><s%> me to the governors <S%H6346><s%> beyond <S%H5676><s%> the River <S%H5104><s%>, that they may let me pass through <S%H5674><s%> till I come <S%H935><s%> unto Judah <S%H3063><s%>;

And the king <S%H4428><s%> granted <S%H5414><s%> me <S%H2896><s%>, according to the good hand <S%H3027><s%> of my God upon me <S%H430><s%>.

Then I came <S%H935><s%> to the governors <S%H6346><s%> beyond <S%H5676><s%> the River <S%H5104><s%>, and gave <S%H5414><s%> them the king <S%H4428><s%>'s letters <S%H107><s%>. Now the king <S%H4428><s%> had sent <S%H7971><s%> with me captains <S%H8269><s%> of the army <S%H2428><s%> and horsemen <S%H6571><s%>.

And when Sanballat <S%H5571><s%> the Horonite <S%H2772><s%>, and Tobiah <S%H2900><s%> the servant <S%H5650><s%>, the Ammonite <S%H5984><s%>, heard <S%H8085><s%> of it <S%H3415><s%>, it grieved them exceedingly <S%H7451><s%>, for that there was come <S%H935><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> to seek <S%H1245><s%> the welfare <S%H2896><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.
So I came <S%H935><s%> to Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, and was there three <S%H7969><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>.

And I arose <S%H6965><s%> in the night <S%H3915><s%>, I and some <S%H4592><s%> few <S%H4592><s%> men <S%H582><s%> with me <S%H5046><s%>; neither told I any man <S%H120><s%> what my God <S%H430><s%> put <S%H5414><s%> into my heart <S%H3820><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> for Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>; neither was there any beast <S%H929><s%> with me <S%H929><s%>, save the beast that I rode upon <S%H7392><s%>.

And I went out <S%H3318><s%> by night <S%H3915><s%> by the valley <S%H1516><s%> gate <S%H8179><s%>, even toward <S%H6440><s%> the jackal <S%H8577><s%>'s well <S%H5869><s%>, and to the dung <S%H830><s%> gate <S%H8179><s%>, and viewed <S%H7663><s%> the walls <S%H2346><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, which were broken down <S%H6555><s%>, and the gates <S%H8179><s%> thereof were consumed <S%H398><s%> with fire <S%H784><s%>.

Then I went on <S%H5674><s%> to the fountain <S%H5869><s%> gate <S%H8179><s%> and to the king <S%H4428><s%>'s pool <S%H1295><s%>: but there was no place <S%H4725><s%> for the beast <S%H929><s%> that was under me to pass <S%H5674><s%>.

Then went I up <S%H5927><s%> in the night <S%H3915><s%> by the brook <S%H5158><s%>, and viewed <S%H7663><s%> the wall <S%H2346><s%>; and I turned back <S%H7725><s%>, and entered <S%H935><s%> by the valley <S%H1516><s%> gate <S%H8179><s%>, and so returned <S%H7725><s%>.

And the rulers <S%H5461><s%> knew <S%H3045><s%> not whither I went <S%H1980><s%>, or what I did <S%H6213><s%>; neither had I as yet <S%H3651><s%> told <S%H5046><s%> it to the Jews <S%H3064><s%>, nor to the priests <S%H3548><s%>, nor to the nobles <S%H2715><s%>, nor to the rulers <S%H5461><s%>, nor to the rest <S%H3499><s%> that did <S%H6213><s%> the work <S%H4399><s%>.

Then said <S%H559><s%> I unto them <S%H7200><s%>, Ye see the evil <S%H7451><s%> case that we are in <S%H3389><s%>, how Jerusalem lieth waste <S%H2720><s%>, and the gates <S%H8179><s%> thereof are burned <S%H3341><s%> with fire <S%H784><s%>: come <S%H3212><s%>, and let us build up <S%H1129><s%> the wall <S%H2346><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, that we be no more a reproach <S%H2781><s%>.

And I told <S%H5046><s%> them of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of my God <S%H430><s%> which was good <S%H2896><s%> upon me <S%H4428><s%>, as also of the king's words <S%H1697><s%> that he had spoken <S%H559><s%> unto me <S%H559><s%>. And they said, Let us rise up <S%H6965><s%> and build <S%H1129><s%>. So they strengthened <S%H2388><s%> their hands <S%H3027><s%> for the good work <S%H2896><s%>.

But when Sanballat <S%H5571><s%> the Horonite <S%H2772><s%>, and Tobiah <S%H2900><s%> the servant <S%H5650><s%>, the Ammonite <S%H5984><s%>, and Geshem <S%H1654><s%> the Arabian <S%H6163><s%>, heard <S%H8085><s%> it <S%H3932><s%>, they laughed us to scorn, and despised <S%H959><s%> us <S%H559><s%>, and said, What is this thing <S%H1697><s%> that ye do <S%H6213><s%>? will ye rebel <S%H4775><s%> against the king <S%H4428><s%>?

Then answered <S%H7725><s%> I them <S%H559><s%>, and said unto them <S%H430><s%>, The God of heaven <S%H8064><s%>, he will prosper <S%H6743><s%> us <S%H5650><s%>; therefore we his servants will arise <S%H6965><s%> and build <S%H1129><s%>: but ye have no portion <S%H2506><s%>, nor right <S%H6666><s%>, nor memorial <S%H2146><s%>, in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>.
